Like my Universal Warrior, this build is designed to be equally effective with all melee weapons, and it was designed with the Aielund Saga in mind.

Edit: I realized I goofed, leaving out Martial Weapons, so I dropped Expertise and shuffled the pre-epic feats around to work it in.
EDIT 2: Tweaked following advice in the comments.
EDIT 3: Toughness is edited out in favor of Knockdown.
EDIT 4: The build didn't have the required 8 Lore in time to get RDD.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
You took "toughness" and "great cleave" but left out "expertise" and "empower" ?!
At first I figured Grt Cleave was a left-over from a DevCrit version but without ImpCrit, that wouldn't have been possible anyway.  But I agree that 26 levels of cleric is going to miss empowering all abilities, HotG, BladeBars, IceStorms and NEB at minimum. Empowered Endurance will not only make up for the lost 40HP but add a Fort to boot.

Then again, maybe the Aielund spell hak mucked around with metamagic enough that empower doesn't work like AD&D anymore (didn't bother reading the hak details because I run the null EMS).

With capped Conc, you could also easily cannabalize the excess UMD and some Lore to make this a reliable taunter.

edit: damm typos are testing my patience

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
This was made back in the days when I thought that level 1 was a good place for Toughness. With a higher-then-average AC and lower-then-average AB, I think that Expertise is not a good idea for this build.
I tried shuffling skill points around to get 31 Taunt, but it was costly. I lost all but 1 point of Lore, and 10 points of UMD, which means being unable to use some weapons that needed UMD, and worst of all, most of the Spellcraft is delayed until the game is almost over, or actually over.
Anyway, I put in Empower Spell and moved Toughness to level 18.

If I were going to play this in Aielund now, I would make a version that focuses on the katana. I would drop Martial Weapons, Power Attack, and Cleave for Weapon Focus, Improved Critical, and ... Luck of Heroes? In epic, I'd drop 2 Great Strength feats for Epic Weapon Focus and Epic Prowess. I would lose 1 AB and gain 4 AB for a net gain of 3 AB (41 AB in mundane gear and unbuffed).

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:
.
I tried shuffling skill points around to get 31 Taunt, but it was costly. I lost all but 1 point of Lore, and 10 points of UMD, which means being unable to use some weapons that needed UMD, and worst of all, most of the Spellcraft is delayed until the game is almost over, or actually over.
 
Probably a question better suited for the Aielund thread but, since the issue arose here...
are you inferring that Aielund's value table is inflated or that they have multiple high-value properties on their gear?  Just a class emulation shouldn't require all that much UMD.

The Expertise/Taunt combo is extremely effective because you'll gain an AB on a max taunt in that mode.  Mr. Kane uses this strategy a lot on WoG and swears by it, but WoG is more of a mid-magic environment.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Forget about "toughness" man, you miss other essential feats for this to be a "universal" warrior-priest, like knock-down/expertise.

A "universal" type should provide "more options" for the player that did the sacrifice of not taking the standard line of feats.


@Hip, Empyre is probably referring to some of the later weapons in Aielund that have +7/+8 enchantment with additional properties like 2d8 elemental dmg and keen/massive criticals.

Although i do not remember how this translates into millions of gp's and relatiive umd checks. Wiki should have some info for this.
